meanings.definition: A government building where duties are collected on imported goods.
meanings.sent1: The customshouse in the city is a large building where taxes are paid on items brought from other countries.
meanings.sent2: I had to go to the customshouse to pay the required fees for the goods I imported.
meanings.sent3: The customshouse was so busy that it felt like a bustling marketplace of taxes and tariffs.
meanings.sent4: The customshouse stood tall like a guardian, watching over the flow of imported goods.
meanings.sent5: As I entered the customshouse, the smell of paperwork and bureaucracy filled the air.

meanings.definition: The government agency responsible for collecting customs duties and enforcing customs regulations.
meanings.sent1: The customshouse ensures that all imported items follow the rules and pay the necessary fees.
meanings.sent2: Working at the customshouse requires a good understanding of trade laws and regulations.
meanings.sent3: The customshouse employees joked that they were the 'tax collectors of the sea'.
meanings.sent4: In the world of trade, the customshouse is the gatekeeper of financial compliance.
meanings.sent5: The customshouse staff diligently checked every package for duty payments.

meanings.definition: The duties or taxes imposed on imported goods.
meanings.sent1: The customshouse fees added to the cost of the imported products.
meanings.sent2: Importers need to factor in customshouse charges when pricing their goods.
meanings.sent3: The customshouse taxes felt like a toll booth on the road to international trade.
meanings.sent4: The customshouse duties acted as a financial barrier to certain imported items.
meanings.sent5: The customshouse levies were a necessary part of cross-border commerce.
